item.title: A Rare Hazard
item.description: In the first episode of the Second Season, we will have a closure for events of the previous episode, with right to terrorism and espionage.

item.title: Glacier Plains
item.description: Glacier Plains is a region on the north-easternmost part of the OverWorld.

item.title: Malvadine
item.description: Malvadine is an Elite Warrior of the Mipedian Tribe.

item.title: Maxxor
item.description: Maxxor is an OverWorld Hero and ruler of the OverWorld Tribe

item.title: Perithon!
item.description: In this episode, after an intense battle and glorious victory over the M’arrillians, the Tribes decide to keep Tribal Alliance towards a prosperous Perim and, to celebrate the peace, they make a car race… but old habits die hard…

item.title: Takinom
item.description: Takinom is an UnderWorld Commander who serves Chaor as one of his Counsellors, along with Agitos.

item.title: Trivias: Legions of Aa'une
item.description: A small video with the Trivia / Quiz originally present in episode Legiôes de Aa’une

item.title: Welcome to Chaotic (Part 1)
item.description: In the first episode of the series, the protagonist, Tom Majors, receives his access code for Chaotic, a place where, according to his best friend, Kaz, you can turn into the Creatures and play for real.

item.title: Dangers of Diplomacy
item.description: In this episode we’ll see that it’s easier to get ants with honey than with vinegar, but that too much honey might not be a very good idea either.

item.title: Lake Ken-I-Po
item.description: Lake Ken-I-Po is a region on the central-south part of the OverWorld.

item.title: Najarin
item.description: Najarin is an OverWorld Muge who serves Maxxor as one of his Counsellors, along with Intress.

item.title: Nauthilax
item.description: Nauthilax is an UnderWorld Elementalist and a maritime spy to his Tribe

item.title: Trivias: Perithon!
item.description: A small video with the Trivia / Quiz originally present in episode Perithon!

item.title: Welcome to Chaotic (Part 2)
item.description: In continuation of the series, after entering his access code, Tom discovers that all of Kaz’s fantasies were real and has his first battle in Chaotic.

item.title: Worlds Apart
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Jycella, Krystella’s twin sister, and we’ll see that the bad relationship between them, common among humans, also happens in Perim, with the twin sisters Aivenna and Nivenna.

item.title: Blazier
item.description: Blazier is an OverWorld Scout and the cartographer of his Tribe.

item.title: H'earring
item.description: H’earring is an UnderWorld Scout and great small a spy for his Tribe.

item.title: Kickin' Bot
item.description: In this episode, Perim’s Dr. Frankenstein decides to implement part of his own brain in the Gigantroopers, making them intelligent enough to try to take over the Underworld, resulting in a battle in the best Pacific Rim style.

item.title: The Floundering Father
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a blabbermouth knows-it-all father getting real after a quadruple challenge.

item.title: Trivias: Worlds Apart
item.description: A small video with the Trivia originally present in episode Worlds Apart

item.title: UnderWorld City
item.description: The UnderWorld City is a region on the central part of the UnderWorld.

item.title: Unexpected
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet the fourth member of the group, Peyton, and his… “eccentric”, personality.

item.title: Chaor
item.description: Chaor is an UnderWorld Conqueror and the Warrior ruler of the UnderWorld Tribe

item.title: Colosseum Showdown
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a small misunderstanding end up in an epic way in the best Real Steel style.

item.title: Crystal Cave
item.description: Crystal Cave is a region on the south-westernmost part of the OverWorld.

item.title: Heptadd
item.description: Heptadd is a powerful Guardian and a Muge of the OverWorld

item.title: Hotekk's Challenge (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, Tom wins the seventh battle in the Hotekk Drome, and thus is challenged by the CodeMaster himself.

item.title: Over-Under Rent Asunder
item.description: The ancient war between Good vs. Evil in the Chaotic universe: OverWorld vs. UnderWorld.

item.title: Trivias: Kickin Bot
item.description: A small video with the Trivia / Quiz originally present in episode Kickin’ Bot

item.title: Crash Course
item.description: In this episode, Kaz faces Klay in a dispute while Tom tries to get the scan of a lunatic Creature whose life is playing tricks.

item.title: Hotekk's Challenge (Parte 2)
item.description: In this episode, after winning CodeMaster Hotekk in a very intelligent way, Tom gets very disappointed with his reward… until he and his friends discover that a desert and not very interesting Location is actually much more than it looks (really!)

item.title: Riverlands
item.description: The Riverlands is a big region on the south-southwest part of the OverWorld.

item.title: Rockwave and Roll
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a match between Peyton and his musical idol, with rights to a subtle tribute to one of KISS’ lead singer Gene Simmons.

item.title: Trivias: Hotekk's Challenge (Part 1)
item.description: A small video with the Trivia / Quiz originally present in episode Hotekk’s Challenge (Part 1)

item.title: Ulmar
item.description: Ulmar is an UnderWorld Conqueror and the mad scientist of his Tribe

item.title: Chaor's Commandos (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode we’ll see an elite squad led by Chaor in a bold raid on Kiru City towards the Overworld Arsenal.

item.title: The Thing About Bodal
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Bodal, a Creature very talkative, annoying and cocky about himself. We’ll also see the most improbable of all fights in Chaotic.

item.title: Trivias: Yesterday's Heroes
item.description: A small video with the Trivia / Quiz originally present in episode Yesterday’s Heroes

item.title: Yesterday's Heroes
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Vlar, a thief renegade by the OverWorld Tribe of Ancient Perim which, possibly, is Maxxor ancestor.

item.title: Buggin' Out
item.description: In this episode we’ll know another of the four Tribes in Chaotic, the Danians, a Tribe formed by insects of all kinds that take the safety of their domains seriously, especially when it comes to Chaotic players.

item.title: Chaor's Commandos (Part 2)
item.description: In the continuation of the previous episode we’ll see Chaor’s invasion to the Overworld Arsenal in Kiru City.

item.title: Losers' Circle
item.description: In this episode, Kaz is so psyched with his new scans from ancient Perim he decides to challenge every player who defeated him, thinking nobody would stand a chance… until his archenemy proves him otherwise.

item.title: Trivias: Losers' Circle
item.description: A small video with the Trivia / Quiz originally present in episode Losers’ Circle

item.title: A Gigantic Mission
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Vlar guiding Kiru and his fighters through the Temple of the ancient Gigantempopolis, when the giants were alive, in an attempt of dissuading Kaal to not invade Kiru City anymore, however, during the trip, the own future of the OverWorld was traced.

item.title: Everything's in Flux
item.description: In this episode we’ll know a little more about Krystella, a player as unprincipled as Klay that does everything, no matter what, to succeed or to prevent those who cross her path to succeed themselves.

item.title: Mega Match
item.description: In this episode we’ll see the internal competition between Kaz and Peyton to see who is the best Chaotic player get to a next level… only now it’s up to Tom.

item.title: Trivias: A Gigantic Mission
item.description: A small video with the Trivia / Quiz originally present in episode A Gigantic Mission

item.title: Castle Bodhran or Bust (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet the story of Reginald Terrington, the problems in which he got himself and the friends’ group attempt to rescue him with a bet that could mean the end of the career in Chaotic of one of them.

item.title: Threshold of Destruction
item.description: In this episode, once Dranakis Threshold’s secret leaked out, several players ported to ancient Perim, including Chaotic’s “Bonnie & Clyde”, who didn’t take long in conspiring with an old acquaintance, making of a painful event become, potentially, irreversible.

item.title: Time's Up
item.description: In this episode we’ll have a grayish, silent, “Futuresight” with a small and subtle spoiler of the Season’s apex.

item.title: A Peytonic Adventure
item.description: In this episode, an adventure in the 007 style in which Peyton is challenged by a world famous art counterfeiter for a Chaotic match.

item.title: Castle Bodhran or Bust (Part 2)
item.description: In the continuation of the previous episode, Tom comes face-to-face with his hero, but before he could even try to rescue Reggie, he must not only gain his trust but also fight a real battle against another Tribe along with his friends.

item.title: Gigantempopolis
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Gigantempopolis, a desert place, full of mysteries, treasures and, of course, curses, in the best The Lord of the Rings style.

item.title: Elementary
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet the four Elemental Servants of the Lost City and a battle in Chaotic with them all at once.

item.title: Lord of Treachery
item.description: In this episode, we’ll meet the treacherous Lord Van Bloot, second in command of the Underworld, and how Chaor makes of Kaz his spy and uses the Chaotic battles as a military strategy against him.

item.title: War Beasts
item.description: In this episode, after a while without mess with other players, Krystella and Klay set up for Peyton to get the scan of a War Beast, a humongous Mipedian titan as powerful as lunatic and, apparently, uncontrollable.

item.title: Battledrome of the Sexes
item.description: In this episode, we’ll discover (or not) who plays Chaotic better, men or women, boys or girls, in a fight between Peyton and Krystella.

item.title: From the Deep (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, a mysterious Creature from a long forgotten past arises again with astonishing and disturbing revelations about the future of Perim.

item.title: Son of the Spiritlands
item.description: In this episode, an indestructible Creature from the Spiritlands threatens to destroy the whole Perim unless Tangath Toborn faces him.

item.title: Battle Lessons
item.description: In this episode Tom gets to know more about the main event in Chaotic: The CodeMasters Matches!

item.title: From the Deep (Part 2)
item.description: In the continuation of the previous episode, betrayal, brainwash, a military coup and the beginning of the end… Let the Invasion begin!

item.title: Tale of Two Toms
item.description: In this episode an easy-going version of our protagonist comes into play and, thanks to an evil pushing, ends up in a fight, in the best Chaotic style.

item.title: The Birth of Borth-Majar
item.description: In this episode we will know the origins of an unusual creature, Borth-Majar, and how Kaz handles their individual personalities and (almost) collective mind.

item.title: Blight Fight
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Garv, the OverWorld Caretaker in charge of Lake Morn, helping Tom (and Smildon) to heal the Prexxor Chasm from the Blight instead of fighting it by brute-force.

item.title: Shifting Sands
item.description: In this episode Peyton shows to Tom that not all of the Mipedians are cruel and pitiless as those he met while rescuing Reggie.

item.title: Fallen Hero
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a treacherous coup of Lord Van Bloot against Maxxor that could destroy the OverWorld.

item.title: Newbie
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Shinwan, a newcomer headstrong enough to be the first in Chaotic to get a M’arrillian scan.

item.title: Putting the Muge in Mugic
item.description: In this episode we’ll have a common (and unnecessary) territorial war complete with treason, sabotage, counter-espionage and lessons of leadership between OverWorlders and Mipedians.

item.title: Scavenger Scan
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Kaz and Peyton competing with each other (again) to see who is the best player of Chaotic between them.

item.title: Allmageddon
item.description: In this episode we’ll know the story of Hoton, a Creature that, seeking for an ancient power to protect everything and everyone he loved, ended up losing everything.

item.title: Mister E
item.description: In this episode we’ll see more about the power of the M’arrillians and the beginning of one of the possible futures shown in “Time’s Up”.

item.title: A Fearsome Fate
item.description: In the previous episodes, Tom finally got a new scan of his favorite Creature, Maxxor, but when he used it for the first time in battle he realizes that something is wrong.

item.title: When a CodeMaster Calls
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Peyton going on a journey into M’arrillian territory in name of CodeMaster Hotekk in order to become his apprentice… said no one ever.

item.title: Earth to Kaz
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Kaz’s passion for Chaotic becoming a problem for him when he needs to prove to the psychologist of his school that Chaotic is a real place o.O

item.title: Maze of Menace
item.description: In this episode, continuing the sequence in which the Commander of the Otherworld, Maxxor, was ambushed by Lord Van Bloot’s treacherous Mugic, we’ll see a partnership between Creatures and humans to restore the Fallen Hero before it’s too late.

item.title: Out in the Cold
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Kaz’s journey through a dangerous path, with an unusual guidance, to the aid of the reclusive Raimusa in the Crystal Range.

item.title: Raznus Returns
item.description: In this episode, a problematic excavation leads some Mandiblors led by Odu-Bathax and Raznus, former OverWorld Ambassador to the Danians, now Assimilated, to the basement of the Arsenal of OverWorld.

item.title: Chaotikings
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Kaz’s initiation in the most famous “club” in Chaotic… or not.

item.title: Warriors of Eternity
item.description: In this episode, Sarah is attacked by a Mipedian ghost and her friends, while searching for her, join a group of Mipedians who are searching for the legendary Owayki and his Stone Warriors, immune to the M’arrillian’s mind control.

item.title: Stelgar Strikes
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Mommark, a mad scientist from the OverWorld, and one of his creations, Stelgar.

item.title: UnderWorld Overthrown
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Chaor and his loyal fighters execute a battle plan against the M’arrillians in the Marsh of Murk.

item.title: The CodeMaster Chronicles (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode we’ll see the first part of the most amazing match in Chaotic: The battle between Tom Majors and the CodeMaster Crellan!

item.title: Triple Threat
item.description: In this episode we’ll see the Tribal Alliance overcoming its cultural differences so they united may have a chance against the M’arrillians.

item.title: Last Stand (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, the beginning of the end… the battle for Perim is now!

item.title: The CodeMaster Chronicles (Part 2)
item.description: In continuation of the previous episode, after having his battle plan ruined because of the mighty Cromaxx, Tom needs to figure out a way to workaround the situation in this epic battle.

item.title: Last Stand (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode, the battle continues in different regions of Perim at once… and in the Tribal Alliance itself as well.

item.title: The Ultimate Scan
item.description: In this episode we’ll know a bit about a mythical Creature called Iparu and its fantastic abilities.

item.title: An Easy Win
item.description: In this episode we’ll see how things can get really ugly when we try to take advantage of a rookie, right Peyton?

item.title: Legions of Aa'une (Season Finale)
item.description: In this episode, the battle continues with overturns and some shifting… and the end!

item.title: A Flux Too Far
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Kaz and Peyton trying to get a scan of the Flux Bauble… or not.

item.title: Chaotic Crisis
item.description: In this episode, the Creatures of Chaotic invade Earth! Let’s get Chaotic… for our planet!

item.title: The Curse of Kor-Bek
item.description: In this episode, set in one of the islands of the archipelago Peyton and Kaz ended up in the episode “A Flux Too Far”, we’ll have pirates, buried treasures, curses and chasing.

item.title: Fire Fighters
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a hot fight, literally, in which both players will try to prove their own superiority as well as of one of of the Four Elements.

item.title: Chasm Quest
item.description: In this episode Tom finally decides to explore the Prexxor Chasm, in Perim, from the scan he got from CodeMaster Crellan until he realizes that something is really wrong.

item.title: Train Wreck
item.description: In this episode, when Kaz starts getting trouble in Chaotic, Peyton helps him with a… “personal trainer”.

item.title: Trading Cards
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a card trading chain engineered by Sarah so she could have the scan of rare Mugic. Of course our gentlemen wouldn’t let her down… right?

item.title: Dual Duel (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Krystella and Klay up to no good (again), resulting in an interesting dual battle for the scan of a wicked Battlegear.

item.title: Dual Duel (Part 2)
item.description: In the continuation of the previous episode, we’ll not only see the ending of the battle in midst of Krystella and Klay’s mental games. And that, well, karma is a bitch ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

item.title: Going Under
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a small part of one of the most known teachings of Sun Tzu’s The Art of War in Chaotic: Know your enemy!

item.title: Big Time
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Sarah’s quest to get the scan of a rare and powerful winged Danian that ends up on her frustrating a kidnapping attempt by an enemy Tribe.

item.title: Eye of the Maelstrom
item.description: In this episode, Tom and his friends will help Najarin and a group of Mipedians in an important mission and that trust is a gift, not a right.

item.title: Fighting Friendly (Season Finale)
item.description: In this episode… the end! Of the season, of a promising career and of a long time friendship…

item.title: Agitos
item.description: Under Construction Uncommon Rarity Energy Mugicians Uncommon 55 1         65 40 85 35 Elements         Biography Preferred Locations Preferred Battlegear Enemies

item.title: Card Search
item.description: Tell us more about the Card (s) you have in mind with the form below and we’ll sneak into Najarin’s Castle to bring some information for you. Remember: being too much specific might have us to stay there long enough to get caught >.<

item.title: Liability Disclaimers, Copyright and Thanks
item.description: Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976, allowance is made for “fair use” for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favour of fair use. Copyright All product names, logos, images and brands are properties of their respective owners. All company, product and service names used in this website are for identification purposes only.

item.title: Terms of Use
item.description: Introduction Chaotic Online is a personal project aiming to revitalize part of the Trading Cards Game “Chaotic” through (limited) remastering of the Animation episodes with the same name aired around 2006 and restorations / recreation of the original images previously publicly available in the Worldwide Web as well as original articles creatively written about Chaotic Universe after research and observation of the existent material. We respect the nature of your personal information and precisely because of that they aren’t requested for your entertainment.
